g.text: Many new infectious diseases in humans have
been derived from animal sources in the past
20 years. Some are highly contagious and fatal.
Vaccination may not be available and antiviral
drugs are not effective enough. Infectious
control is important in clinical medicine and
syndrome (SARS), as an example, is a highly
recently been reported in Asia, North America,
and Europe. Within a matter of weeks, the
outbreak has evolved to become a global
health threat and more than 30 countries have
been afﬂicted with a novel Coronavirus strain
(SARS-CoV) that is the aetiologic agent of
SARS. The primary route of transmission of
susceptible to the infection as routine
are usually performed in a setting that has
hospital in the world that has just gone
through the largest outbreak of SARS, we
would like to share our strategy, measures, and
spreading of SARS infection as an infection
control model. SARS is one of the many
viruses against which personnel will need
protecting in an ophthalmic setting. The
established might also apply to other
such as the avian inﬂuenza with H5N1.
Severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) is the
‘modern plague’ of the new era for its
infectivity, novelty, casualty, and high fatality.
Hong Kong, Guangdong Province, some other
Vietnam, Canada, and the whole world are now
under unprecedented threats from this deadly
is believed to be a novel Coronavirus strain
(SARS-CoV) that is not closely related to any of
according to the World Health Organization
The awful impact of this disease can be reﬂected
by the alarming health-care statistics recorded
since the massive outbreak in Hong Kong on
with a total number of deaths of 299 and among
themeight of the deceased were doctors, nurses,
SARS has unveiled many virgin health-care
issues that have not caught the attention of the
general public in the past and the whole health-
care system in Hong Kong has been
SARS in terms of changes in daily practices and
